title: 2015 BMW i8: Is i The New M? - Ignition Ep. 115

comments.text: Okay I'll just save for a Huracan...﻿

comments.text: 2:48 " the reason being is THIS".......nothing happens....﻿
comments.author: Hugh Jass

comments.text:
A 3 cylinder car that makes 223hp? That motor is going to blow up before 
you can make it off the lot!﻿
comments.author: Hugh Jass

comments.text: 0 - 60 in 3.6 seconds. That is fast﻿
comments.author: Kyle Thompson

comments.text:
BMW did what Audi did with the R8 when it came out. Its the next futuristic

comments.text: What Is The Color Of The i8?﻿

comments.text: could you see this guy pulling up in this car﻿
comments.author: Robert Rauch

comments.text:
just can not take this review seriously because the stupid camo baseball 
hat﻿
comments.author: Robert Rauch

comments.text:
I'd much rather have the jaguar. It just feels more natural, it looks, 
sounds, and actually is aggressive by its very nature. The exhaust pops and 
clicks and roars, unlike the lawnmower the i8 has in the back. It's pretty 
much a british muscle car, and there's nothing not to love about it.
Yes, it's terrible for the environment, but it's not like there are going 
to be hundreds of thousands of them rolling around, supercars shouldn't be 
too much of a concern for the environment. ﻿
comments.author: Jose Lopez

comments.text:
Really good review. I really like how you present. It sounds like you are 
talking to a real good friend of yours sitting in passenger seat. You and 
Carlos are the reasons why i watch motor trend reviews. Some other 
reviewers are pretty good too. Go motor trend!﻿

comments.text: 150k I'll pass but impressive looks and performance. ﻿

comments.text: I'd take the Jag﻿
comments.author: RAJohnson713

comments.text:
"Of course it's fake, but who cares"
Umm, I'm sorry, but fake engine noises are pointless
One of BMWs biggest flaws is fake engine noise piped into the stereo system
"Who doesn't like 3 cylinders"
Yeah, about that, if I'm gonna pay $100,000+ for a sports car, I don't care 
if it's a performance hybrid, but I *don't* want an idiotic 3 cylinder 
engine in the back, much less one with a fake engine noise so you think you 
have a bigger and more powerful engine in the back﻿
comments.author: Logan “Decepticat” Von Meow

comments.text: the i8 is ok but I'd much rather have the 2016 NSX﻿
comments.author: Shaiyan Hossain (The Doctor)

comments.text:
I actually like this car, and I'm mostly all American when it comes to 
automobiles. My only beef with it is that all these companies seem to have 
the same motto
"Let's build a car that can save the world and give it a price tag that not 
many can buy!" ﻿

comments.text: No petroleum no deal I'd rather ride a bicycle......nextttt﻿
comments.author: Av Mian

comments.text: 11:00 pooping out a Porsche!!!﻿
comments.author: mhks68

comments.text:
It is a marvelous feat to have a hybrid like this do ~4 sec 0-62mph.
We're talking a 1.5 L 3 cylinder engine + an electric motor. This car can 
go long without refueling as well.
Yet it has sports car performance and looks awesome.

I love it, if I had the cash I rather have this than a Ferrari.﻿

comments.text: I'll take the jag ﻿

If I ever would be that...amazed by a car I'm driving, all I would say 
would be - "this is fucking awesome.......this is fucking awesome, this is 
fucking awesome......hooly shit......this is fucking awesome. This is so 
good....this is fucking awesome." Obviously he is a person who gets paid 
for being so....exaggerated about something.﻿

comments.author: Chirag Kharote

comments.text:
Ok i will go ahead a say it. The reason it gets more attention in the 
design department than Maserati, Pagani, Ferrarri, and Lambos is due to the 
universal BMW brand nuthuggery that is rampant in today's world. Every kid, 
aunt, grandpa, dad, soccer mom in the present day are BMW fanboys whether 
or not they own one, sad but true reality of this world. 

No one in their right mind would put this car design wise over a pagani, 
ferrarri, aston martin etc. The fanboy culture is destroying this world and 
will soon start impacting the economy. ﻿
comments.author: Rich Homie Tron

comments.text:
I can get a faster Tesla(obviously looks worse because that's how Elon Musk 
rolls) for a couple dozen grand less than the i8. Unless you're planning on 
going on road trips in this car, there's no doubt the Model S is a better 
call. It's a great car that I would love to have if it was priced in a 
category where it could actually beat the competition. If you want 
efficiency you get a Model S, if you want speed you get something less 
efficient, if you want both you can buy one of each for that price. You buy 
this because you WANT an i8, not because you can handily justify it.﻿

comments.author: reppep296

comments.text:
People will comment negatively on what they can't afford. They will deride 
and make fun of it. Congrats on the guy that ordered it, mine came in two 
days ago, I've already driven it and it's an amazing machine. I currently 
on 3 modern M's M6 Gran coupe, 2015 M4 and an X6 M. I was completely blown 
away by how good the 2015 i8 felt. 

What I didn't like was them trying to sell it to me for nearly twice the 
price I was told when ordering it. Them comparing it to a supercar again, 
no. It's an amazing machine though.﻿
comments.author: ModernEugenix

comments.text:
I have seen the i8 several months ago on the Autobahn, in real world it 
looks EPIC its like fresh air blowing through the rush hour traffic, it was 
a testmule marked as Testwagen, the front end is so low that a Audi R8 
front looks like a SUV next to it. The price is for sure not cheap but you 
get hell of a car, all carbon chassie, one of the best hybrid systems in a 
under 4s 0-60mph car. able to run  all electric if needed to get intolow 
emisison, ultra low emission or zero emission zones of worlds megacitys 
were most of the Sportscar´s of old style have to stay out.  In europe are 
already 70 large citys in 8 countrys with low emission zones and many of 
them prepare to get to ultra low emission if not zero emission in the 
future... example megacity London wants ultra low emission by 2020...most 
cars of today have to stay outside the city ...example there are areas in 
hongkong already allowed only to drive with electric vehicles...good luck 
with your Hellcat or Jaguar getting home if u life there﻿
